title: Fidelity Bank launches 'Save for Gold' Promotion
text:
12 August 2015 11:36 CET Fidelity Bank launches 'Save for Gold' Promotion By Joy Business | Kuuku Abban 
Customers of Fidelity Bank have been presented with an opportunity to not only see gold bars perhaps for the first time, but to own them. 
This is because the bank has launched a 6-month promotion dubbed Save for Gold aimed at rewarding its existing as well as new customers with gold coins and bars worth over È»500,000. 
The promotion according to the bank is also to engender a savings culture among Ghanaians. 
Speaking with Joy Business at the launch, Managing Director of the Bank Edward Effah said although the economic conditions in the country makes it difficult for most people to save, the long-term benefits of savings should influence savings. 
He called for an improvement in the savings culture among Ghanaians saying “if you take savings in Ghana as a proportion of GDP, it is evident that our savings culture needs to be improved as a country. 
“The economic circumstance in the country is perhaps also preventing a lot of people from saving any significant amounts of money”, he added. 
Mr. Effah stated that comparing Ghana to certain developed countries and even other African countries like South Africa or Egypt, shows that those countries have high proportions of savings contributing to their GDP than Ghana has. 
“It is therefore, important that we promote the culture of savings for the long term and this would enable or encourage many Ghanaians to save and at the same time win a price of gold. Ultimately, the final winner will walk away with a 1 kilogram, 24 karat gold bar” he added.
